claim: A statement of a public and famous university (Antioquia University) says that Colombia will have 500 deaths of coronavirus per day.
label: FALSE

claim: No deaths were actually caused by Covid-19 alone
label: FALSE

claim: Eiffel tower reopens with hommage to COVID-19 deaths.
label: Misleading

claim: The director of the Hospital de Clínicas (CABA, Argentina) forged death certificates to increase deaths from coronavirus.
label: FALSE

claim: A Facebook post compares deaths by influenza and Covid-19, in a way that suggests all influenza deaths are now counted as Covid-19
label: FALSE

claim: A TV presenter of the German ZDF falsely stated that there are 130 million COVID-19 deaths in the USA and didn’t correct his error
label: FALSE

claim: Claim that Universidad de Antioquia (UdeA), in Colombia, predicted ‘almost a thousand deaths per day’ at the peak of COVID-19.
label: FALSE

claim: The low number of deaths from COVID-19 in Japan is due to the “difference in the level of ‘social standards’ between Japan and other countries”.
label: Misleading

claim: A Facebook sharepic shows very low death rates for COVID-19 in several European countries
label: Partially false

claim: Infant deaths decreased dramatically during the lockdown, when the number of vaccines administered was reduced; vaccines are a cause of sudden infant death syndrome
label: FALSE

claim: Democrats to blame for Covid-19 related deaths. They control the drugs against the virus.
label: FALSE

claim: A phrase that is attributed to the president of the Community of Madrid, Isabel Díaz Ayuso, who allegedly said that “the deaths from coronavirus are the fault of the doctors and not mine.”
label: FALSE

claim: A graphic that the Argentine president, Alberto Fernández, showed about the fall in GDP and the deaths by country.
label: MISLEADING

claim: Video shows the dead bodies of Covid-19 patients being dumped in the ocean in Mexico.
label: FALSE

claim: Wearing a mask during an epidemic causes death.
label: FALSE
